availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel and Druzilla Marshall. Brother of S.N. Marshall. Married to Keren S. Marshall. Father of Arelian A. Marshall. Farmer in Spencer County in 1850, and in Shelby County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, District Two, p. 112. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 229. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby Count, District One, p. 362. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District One, p. 271. Find A Grave, "James W. Marshall (1824-1890)," Memorial # 31355368, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/31355368/james-w.-marshall (accessed April 7, 2018).
